channel.title: BBC News - Science & Environment

item.title: SpaceX: Inspiration4 amateur astronauts return to Earth after three days
item.description: The four amateur astronauts landed safely in the Atlantic Ocean after three days orbiting Earth.

item.title: Boris Johnson to call for climate action during US visit
item.description: Boris Johnson will also visit the White House for the first time since Joe Biden became US president.

item.title: Climate change: UN warning over nations' climate plans
item.description: Climate plans of more than 100 countries show we're heading in the wrong direction, the UN says.

item.title: Climate change: Should green campaigners put more pressure on China to slash emissions?
item.description: UK activists have protested on the M25, but should they instead be picketing China's embassy?

item.title: Earthshot Prize: Prince William's environment finalists unveiled
item.description: The 15 finalists of Prince William's inaugural Earthshot Prize are tackling the planet's problems.

item.title: Antarctic: Exhibition recalls Ernest Shackleton's final quest
item.description: It's 100 years since the great Antarctic explorer set out on his last voyage to the White Continent.

item.title: California fires: General Sherman and other sequoias given blankets
item.description: Fire-resistant blankets protect General Sherman and other sequoias as a California blaze closes in.

item.title: Inspiration4: All-amateur space crew enjoy views of Earth
item.description: The first pictures have been released showing the Inspiration4 crew looking down on the planet.

item.title: Astronauts return to Earth after China's longest space mission
item.description: The three astronauts spent 90 days at China's space station, some 380km above Earth.

item.title: Carbon emitters 'failing to disclose climate risks'
item.description: In a study of more than 100 company accounts, 80% of audits didn't assess climate risk.

item.title: Ocean Photographer of the Year 2021
item.description: An image of a green sea turtle surrounded by glass fish wins photo award.

item.title: Sir Clive Sinclair: Computing pioneer dies aged 81
item.description: The inventor, entrepreneur and ZX Spectrum creator died at his London home following a long illness.

item.title: Kew Gardens: Royal Botanic Gardens breaks record for largest plant collection
item.description: Established in 1759, the Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew has 16,900 unique plant species.

item.title: Canadian prairie ranchers struggle with drought conditions
item.description: Amid a severe drought in the Prairies, some ranchers are trying to find ways to work with nature.

item.title: Pakistan: How to cool Karachi as temperatures rise
item.description: In Karachi, Pakistan, one entrepreneur is on a mission to plant urban forests to cope with rising temperatures.

item.title: Mangrove forests: Photography winners show beauty of ecosystems
item.description: The Mangrove Photography Award winners show unique ecosystems above and below the waterline.

item.title: Australian bandicoot brought back from brink of extinction
item.description: The small furry Eastern Barred Bandicoot is bumped off an Australian "extinct in the wild" list.

item.title: Unmanned submarine earmarked for Irish Sea freight crossings
item.description: A start-up company has been given £380,000 to develop the hydrogen-powered concept.

item.title: Climate change: Young people very worried - survey
item.description: Over half of respondents in a survey believe humanity is doomed and governments are failing to act.

item.title: Life at 50C: The toxic gas flares fuelling Nigeria's climate change
item.description: Joy and her family are among 2m Nigerians living within 4km of a gas flare in Nigeria's oil-rich south.

item.title: COP26: UK still lagging on climate policy, report says
item.description: UK policies will deliver a quarter of emissions cuts needed, say campaigners ahead of the COP26 summit.

item.title: Climate change: Fossil fuels must stay underground, scientists say
item.description: Almost 60% of oil and gas and 90% of coal must stay in the ground to keep global warming below 1.5C.

item.title: Then and now: Why deforestation is such a hot topic
item.description: Trees are part of the solution for climate change, but are we felling more than we are planting?

item.title: 'I care about the climate but my dad works in the oil industry'
item.description: Stephanie worries about climate change, but her dad is a senior employee at BP.

item.title: COP26: Poorest countries fear not reaching UK for climate summit
item.description: Twenty of the world's poorest countries face hotel quarantine before the event in Glasgow.

item.title: UK 'cut climate pledges' to clinch Australia trade deal
item.description: Government ministers agreed to cut climate commitments to clinch the deal it has emerged.

item.title: International Space Station: Smoke triggers alert on board
item.description: The alarm went off as the space station's batteries were being charged, Russia's space agency says.

item.title: How green is Scotland's space industry?
item.description: Scotland's thriving space sector is trying to have a reduced impact on the planet.

item.title: Sir Clive Sinclair: Tireless inventor ahead of his time
item.description: The prolific innovator invented the pocket calculator and the ill-fated Sinclair C5 electric car.

item.title: Asteroid that wiped out dinosaurs shaped fortunes of snakes
item.description: Snakes owe their success in part to the asteroid impact that killed off the dinosaurs 66 million years ago.

item.title: Megapod of feeding humpback whales in Australia 'so special'
item.description: More than 100 humpback whales have been filmed feeding off Australia's New South Wales coast.

item.title: Climate change: World now sees twice as many days over 50C
item.description: BBC research finds the number of days passing 50C has doubled in the past 40 years.

item.title: Canada election: Lytton fire puts village at centre of debate
item.description: A village in western Canada recorded the country's highest-ever temperature. The next day it was gone.

item.title: Green jobs: The new generation of workers making it work for them
item.description: Science editor David Shukman on three jobs in growing green industries, and what it's like to do them

item.title: Saving Australian frog species on the brink of extinction
item.description: Scientists fear four species are already extinct but say urgent action can save others.

item.title: Spider season: Why your home might feel full of arachnids right now
item.description: They're not coming through the windows - they were already inside.

item.title: Tuna bounce back, but sharks in 'desperate' decline
item.description: Extinction list update reveals mixed news for marine life, as world conservation summit open in France.

item.title: Wildlife photo: Is this the world's most beautiful mosquito?
item.description: Both beauty and beast. A Sabethes mosquito is visually stunning but it's also a carrier of disease.
